snippet: MittRomney's early win leaves anchors scrambling and a dispute between Google and Twitter gets personal.
abstract: MittRomney's early win leaves anchors scrambling and a dispute between Google and Twitter gets personal.
lead_paragraph: That Mitt Romney's victory in the New Hampshire primary was considered all but assured even before the voting began on Tuesday didn't stop the news coverage from going into overdrive, Brian Stelter reports. But the operation appeared to be running on fumes. Once a winner was crowned -- at 8 p.m., precisely when all polls were closed -- the topic turned to second place. That, too, was over early, with Ron Paul declared the runner-up in that same hour. The focus then turned to South Carolina, and how Mr. Romney would fare in a state that would test his conservative credentials: CNN had already assembled a group of undecided Republicans there, Mr. Stelter writes, while Fox News promoted its debate there on Monday.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: The Spielberg Exception and Who's Illin'?
